channel.title: Exp rates?
channel.description: The exp rate in my server is 120 xp per hit, where do i go to change it?

item.title: Exp rates?
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

or if that doesn’t work search for combatexprate (no spaces)

item.title: Exp rates?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Telenim, post:8, topic:313085”]TotalExp = (double)(50*hitDiff);

The 50 is what EXP is gives[/quote]
Noob its:

TotalExp = (int)(50*hitDiff);

The EXP are always ints (well in sources I’ve seen) not doubles. Why? Because why would you have decimals in a EXP value?

Read full topic

item.title: Exp rates?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

look, this is what i get when i search hit diff

hitDiff=

then the second time

playerId
playermax hit str prayer hitDiff[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2009, 10:52:41 am[/size][hr]i want to change the exp to 500 exp a hit [br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2009, 11:23:28 am[/size][hr]if (UseBow || UseCrossBow || UseRing) {
TotalExp = (double)(120hitDiff);
TotalExp = (double)(TotalExpCombatExpRate);
addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), 4);
} else if (FightType != 3) {
TotalExp = (double)(120hitDiff);
TotalExp = (double)(TotalExpCombatExpRate);
addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), SkillID);
} else {
TotalExp = (double)(50hitDiff);
TotalExp = (double)(TotalExpCombatExpRate);
addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerAttack);
addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerDefence);
addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerStrength);
}
TotalExp = (double)(50hitDiff);
TotalExp = (double)(TotalExpCombatExpRate);
addSkillXP((int)(TotalExp), playerHitpoints);
attackTimer = 7;
specOn = false;
specAttack();
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2009, 11:23:50 am[/size][hr]i found that in client.java, it do with anything?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2009, 11:38:06 am[/size][hr]respond pls…
